I was thinking that the int(idx) was added because, with tensors and variables being merged, indexing a 1d tensor now gives a 0d tensor (as done in the place I mentioned) and not a python number anymore.

And I have the impression that the int(idx) was added to fix a failing test somewhere. But now given that scalars that don't require grad can be automatically cast to int, maybe that cast is not necessary anymore?

body:
I was thinking that the `int(idx)` was added because, with tensors and variables being merged, indexing a 1d tensor now gives a 0d tensor (as done in the place I mentioned) and not a python number anymore.

And I have the impression that the `int(idx)` was added to fix a failing test somewhere. But now given that scalars that don't require grad can be automatically cast to `int`, maybe that cast is not necessary anymore?
